verses.kjv: Thou therefore, my son, be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.
verses.web: You therefore, my child, be strengthened in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.
verses.ct: So, my son, draw your strength from the grace that comes through Christ Jesus.

verses.kjv: And the things that thou hast heard of me among many witnesses, the same commit thou to faithful men, who shall be able to teach others also.
verses.web: The things which you have heard from me among many witnesses, commit the same things to faithful men, who will be able to teach others also.
verses.ct: Take everything you've heard me teach in front of many witnesses and pass it on to trustworthy people who are able to teach others as well.

verses.kjv: Thou therefore endure hardness, as a good soldier of Jesus Christ.
verses.web: You therefore must endure hardship as a good soldier of Christ Jesus.
verses.ct: Be willing to endure hardship like a good soldier of Christ Jesus.

verses.kjv: No man that warreth entangleth himself with the affairs of this life; that he may please him who hath chosen him to be a soldier.
verses.web: No soldier on duty entangles himself in the affairs of life, that he may please him who enrolled him as a soldier.
verses.ct: A soldier on active duty doesn't get tangled up in civilian affairs — his goal is to please the one who enlisted him.

verses.kjv: And if a man also strive for masteries, yet is he not crowned, except he strive lawfully.
verses.web: Also, if anyone competes in athletics, he isn’t crowned unless he has competed by the rules.
verses.ct: In the same way, an athlete doesn't win the prize unless he competes by the rules.

verses.kjv: The husbandman that laboureth must be first partaker of the fruits.
verses.web: The farmer who labors must be the first to get a share of the crops.
verses.ct: The farmer who does the hard work should be the first to enjoy the harvest.

verses.kjv: Consider what I say; and the Lord give thee understanding in all things.
verses.web: Consider what I say, and may the Lord give you understanding in all things.
verses.ct: Think carefully about what I'm saying, and may the Lord give you understanding in all of this.

verses.kjv: Remember that Jesus Christ of the seed of David was raised from the dead according to my gospel:
verses.web: Remember Jesus Christ, risen from the dead, of the offspring of David, according to my Good News,
verses.ct: Keep your focus on Jesus Christ — a descendant of David, raised from the dead. This is the heart of my gospel.

verses.kjv: Wherein I suffer trouble, as an evil doer, even unto bonds; but the word of God is not bound.
verses.web: in which I suffer hardship to the point of chains as a criminal. But God’s word isn’t chained.
verses.ct: Because of this gospel, I'm suffering to the point of being chained up like a criminal. But God's word can't be chained.

verses.kjv: Therefore I endure all things for the elect’s sakes, that they may also obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory.
verses.web: Therefore I endure all things for the chosen ones’ sake, that they also may obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory.
verses.ct: That's why I endure everything for the sake of God's chosen people, so that they too can receive the salvation that comes through Christ Jesus, along with eternal glory.

verses.kjv: It is a faithful saying: For if we be dead with him, we shall also live with him:
verses.web: This saying is trustworthy: “For if we died with him, we will also live with him.
verses.ct: Here is a saying you can trust: If we died with him, we will also live with him.

verses.kjv: If we suffer, we shall also reign with him: if we deny him, he also will deny us:
verses.web: If we endure, we will also reign with him. If we deny him, he also will deny us.
verses.ct: If we endure, we will also reign with him. If we deny him, he will also deny us.

verses.kjv: If we believe not, yet he abideth faithful: he cannot deny himself.
verses.web: If we are faithless, he remains faithful; for he can’t deny himself.”
verses.ct: Even if we are faithless, he remains faithful — because he cannot deny who he is.

verses.kjv: Of these things put them in remembrance, charging them before the Lord that they strive not about words to no profit, but to the subverting of the hearers.
verses.web: Remind them of these things, charging them in the sight of the Lord, that they don’t argue about words, to no profit, to the subverting of those who hear.
verses.ct: Keep reminding people of these things. Warn them before the Lord not to argue over words. It does no good and only ruins those who listen.

verses.kjv: Study to shew thyself approved unto God, a workman that needeth not to be ashamed, rightly dividing the word of truth.
verses.web: Give diligence to present yourself approved by God, a workman who doesn’t need to be ashamed, properly handling the Word of Truth.
verses.ct: Work hard to present yourself to God as someone he approves of — a worker who has no reason to be ashamed, handling the word of truth with skill and accuracy.

verses.kjv: But shun profane and vain babblings: for they will increase unto more ungodliness.
verses.web: But shun empty chatter, for it will go further in ungodliness,
verses.ct: Stay away from godless, empty talk, because it only leads people deeper into ungodliness.

verses.kjv: And their word will eat as doth a canker: of whom is Hymenaeus and Philetus;
verses.web: and those words will consume like gangrene, of whom is Hymenaeus and Philetus:
verses.ct: That kind of teaching spreads like gangrene. Hymenaeus and Philetus are perfect examples.

verses.kjv: Who concerning the truth have erred, saying that the resurrection is past already; and overthrow the faith of some.
verses.web: men who have erred concerning the truth, saying that the resurrection is already past, and overthrowing the faith of some.
verses.ct: They've wandered away from the truth by claiming the resurrection has already happened, and they're destroying the faith of some believers.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless the foundation of God standeth sure, having this seal, The Lord knoweth them that are his. And, Let every one that nameth the name of Christ depart from iniquity.
verses.web: However God’s firm foundation stands, having this seal, “The Lord knows those who are his,” and, “Let every one who names the name of the Lord depart from unrighteousness.”
verses.ct: But God's foundation stands firm, and it carries this seal: "The Lord knows those who are his," and "Everyone who claims the name of Christ must turn away from sin."

verses.kjv: But in a great house there are not only vessels of gold and of silver, but also of wood and of earth; and some to honour, and some to dishonour.
verses.web: Now in a large house there are not only vessels of gold and of silver, but also of wood and of clay. Some are for honor, and some for dishonor.
verses.ct: In a large house, you don't just find dishes made of gold and silver. There are also ones made of wood and clay. Some are kept for special occasions, and others are used for ordinary purposes.

verses.kjv: If a man therefore purge himself from these, he shall be a vessel unto honour, sanctified, and meet for the master’s use, and prepared unto every good work.
verses.web: If anyone therefore purges himself from these, he will be a vessel for honor, sanctified, and suitable for the master’s use, prepared for every good work.
verses.ct: If someone cleanses himself from dishonorable things, he becomes like a dish set apart for special use — made holy, useful to the master, and ready for every good work.

verses.kjv: Flee also youthful lusts: but follow righteousness, faith, charity, peace, with them that call on the Lord out of a pure heart.
verses.web: Flee from youthful lusts; but pursue righteousness, faith, love, and peace with those who call on the Lord out of a pure heart.
verses.ct: Run from the desires that tempt young people. Instead, pursue righteousness, faith, love, and peace alongside everyone who calls on the Lord with a pure heart.

verses.kjv: But foolish and unlearned questions avoid, knowing that they do gender strifes.
verses.web: But refuse foolish and ignorant questionings, knowing that they generate strife.
verses.ct: Don't get drawn into foolish, ignorant debates. You know they only produce conflict.

verses.kjv: And the servant of the Lord must not strive; but be gentle unto all men, apt to teach, patient,
verses.web: The Lord’s servant must not quarrel, but be gentle toward all, able to teach, patient,
verses.ct: The Lord's servant must not quarrel. Instead, he should be gentle with everyone, able to teach, and patient,

verses.kjv: In meekness instructing those that oppose themselves; if God peradventure will give them repentance to the acknowledging of the truth;
verses.web: in gentleness correcting those who oppose him: perhaps God may give them repentance leading to a full knowledge of the truth,
verses.ct: correcting opponents with gentleness. Perhaps God will give them repentance that leads to a full knowledge of the truth,

verses.kjv: And that they may recover themselves out of the snare of the devil, who are taken captive by him at his will.
verses.web: and they may recover themselves out of the devil’s snare, having been taken captive by him to his will.
verses.ct: and they'll come to their senses and escape the devil's trap, where he's been holding them captive to do his will.
